Namespace: scratchPad

temtem.file. scratchPad

Source:

Methods

<static> copyFile

Not available in Web Reports Copies a file from the file system into a sub-path in the Console's temporary "scratchpad" area of the file system.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
inputPath String
scratchPath String
allowOverwriteFlag Boolean If false, then an error will be returned if the file already exists.
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1276

<static> copyFolder

Not available in Web Reports Copy all of the files contained in the folder specified by the inputPath to the sub-folder of the ScratchRoot folder specified by scratchPath. The destination folder must exist already. If the recurseFlag is true then all of the sub-folders will be copied as well as the files, and new destination sub-folders will be created. If a source file or sub-folder already exists in the destination folder, it will cause an error.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
inputPath String
scratchPath String If true then all of the sub-folders will be copied as well as the files, and new destination sub-folders will be created.
recurseFlag Boolean
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1292

<static> deleteAllFiles

Not available in Web Reports Delete all the files in the folder located at the given sub-path of the ScratchRoot folder. If recurseFlag is true, then all the files in all of the sub-directories will also be deleted. Note that this function does not delete any folders.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
scratchPath String
recurseFlag Boolean If recurseFlag is true, then all the files in all of the sub-directories will also be deleted.
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1305

Not available in Web Reports Delete all the files in the folder located at the given sub-path of the ScratchRoot folder. If recurseFlag is true, then all the files in all of the sub-directories will also be deleted. Note that this function does not delete any folders.

<static> deleteTree

Not available in Web Reports Delete the folder located at the given sub-path of the ScratchRoot folder and all of its contents.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
scratchPath String
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1335

<static> getScratchRootPath

Not available in Web Reports This function returns the path to the temporary folder where all "scratch" files are created. In the functions below, some of the inputs are a full path, and some are a a sub-path of the ScrathRoot folder. If you need to use a ScratchRoot sub-path as the input to one of the functions that requires a full path, then you need to prepend the results of this function to the sub-path.
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1382

<static> makeFolder

Not available in Web Reports Create a folder at the given sub-path of the ScratchRoot folder.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
scratchPath String
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1344

<static> moveFile

Not available in Web Reports Move a file from one location under the ScratchRoot folder to another. You cannot move files that are located outside the scratch area.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
scratchPathSrc String
scratchPathDest String
allowOverwriteFlag Boolean
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1356

<static> writeFile

Not available in Web Reports Writes the given string into the file located at the given sub-path of the ScratchRoot folder. If the appendFlag is false, then the file will be created if it does not exist, and will be over-written if it does exist. If the appendFlag is true, then the file must exist, and the text will be appended to the contents of the existing file.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
text String
scratchPath String
appendFlag Boolean
Source:
  • ../src/ADF/API/ADFAPI.js, line 1370
